intro: Spermacoce stachydea var. phyllocephala, commonly known as the broad-leafed ladies' fingers, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface and produces small, white to pinkish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
